objects.name: Tank
objects.description: Primary combat unit controlled by players.
objects.special_rules: Can respawn at BASE after destruction.
objects.source_note: Mentioned in gameplay phases and map design philosophy.

objects.name: BASE
objects.description: Spawn and upgrade area for tanks.
objects.special_rules: Provides strong buffs to counter spawn-camping.
objects.source_note: Defined in the table detailing map elements.

objects.name: Outpost
objects.description: Strategic points that teams must capture or defend.
objects.special_rules: Multiple entry points and chokepoints; capture time ranges from 60-90 seconds.
objects.source_note: Detailed in the outpost distribution and combat zone analysis.

objects.name: Choke Point
objects.description: Narrow areas that limit tank movement.
objects.special_rules: Allows only 1-2 tanks to pass through, creating high-stakes tactical moments.
objects.source_note: Defined in the table of map elements.

systems.name: Outpost Breaker Game Mode
systems.description: A gamemode where teams compete to capture or defend outposts.
systems.mechanics: ATK team must destroy all outposts or achieve 20 kills; DEF team must prevent this or achieve 20 kills.
systems.objectives: Capture or defend outposts within a time limit or achieve kill objectives.
interactions: Tanks (obj_001) interact with Outposts (obj_003) to capture or defend them.
BASE (obj_002) serves as respawn and upgrade area for Tanks (obj_001).
systems.source_note: Described in the gameplay mechanics section.

systems.name: Combat System
systems.description: System governing player engagements during outpost battles.
systems.mechanics: Engagements occur in combat zones (CZ) near outposts, with varying combat ratios (1v1, 2v2, teamfights).
systems.objectives: Control combat zones to gain positional advantage and complete objectives.
interactions: Tanks (obj_001) engage in combat near Outposts (obj_003).
Choke Points (obj_004) influence combat dynamics by limiting movement.
systems.source_note: Detailed in the combat zone and engagement ratio analysis.

logic_rules.description: Players respawn at BASE after their tank is destroyed.
logic_rules.effect: Player respawns at BASE after 5 seconds.
logic_rules.source_note: Defined in the respawn phase table.

logic_rules.description: Outposts can be captured by controlling the area for 60-90 seconds.
logic_rules.trigger: Team controls outpost area without interruption.
logic_rules.effect: Outpost changes ownership or is destroyed.
logic_rules.source_note: Detailed in the outpost capture time analysis.

logic_rules.description: Choke points limit tank movement, creating strategic bottlenecks.
logic_rules.effect: Only 1-2 tanks can pass through, increasing vulnerability.
logic_rules.source_note: Defined in the choke point table.

requirements.title: Balanced Outpost Design
requirements.description: Ensure outposts are balanced between attackers and defenders.
requirements.acceptance_criteria: Outposts A and B favor balanced play; Outpost C favors defenders.
requirements.source_note: Discussed in the outpost distribution and combat zone analysis.

requirements.title: Dynamic Combat Zones
requirements.description: Design combat zones to encourage varied tactical approaches.
requirements.acceptance_criteria: Combat zones dynamically shift based on player behavior.
requirements.source_note: Mentioned in the combat zone buffer analysis.

requirements.title: Replayability Through Map Design
requirements.description: Ensure maps remain engaging across multiple playthroughs.
requirements.acceptance_criteria: Maps support diverse strategies and meta shifts.
requirements.source_note: Highlighted in the map design philosophy.
